Package xxl.core.spatial.geometries

The package geometries provides interfaces for a spatial data model which conforms to the geometry model of the OGC Simple Features Specification for SQL (See http://www.opengis.org for further details).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Curve2D
    A Curve is a one-dimensional geometric object usually stored as a sequence of points, with the subtype of Curve specifying the form of the interpolation between points.
    Geometry2D
    This is the base interface of the geometry model in XXL.
    GeometryCollection2D<T extends Geometry2D>
    A GeometryCollection2D is a geometry that is a collection of 1 or more geometries.
    Line2D
    A Line is a LineString with exactly 2 points.
    LinearRing2D
    A LinearRing is a LineString that is both closed and simple.
    LineString2D
    A LineString is a Curve with linear interpolation between points.
    MultiCurve2D<T extends Curve2D>
    A MultiCurve2D is a one-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.
    MultiLineString2D<T extends LineString2D>
    A MultiLineString is a MultiCurve2D whose elements are LineStrings.
    MultiPoint2D<T extends Point2D>
    A MultiPoint2D is a 0 dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Points.
    MultiPolygon2D<T extends Polygon2D>
    This is a MultiSurface2D which can only hold Polygon2D- objects It does not provide additional functionality to MultiSurface but is implemented for completeness.
    MultiSurface2D<T extends Surface2D>
    A GeometryCollection which can only hold Surface2D- objects

    See
    		Point2D
    A Point2D is a 0-dimensional geometry and represents a single location in coordinate space.
    Polygon2D
    A Curve is a one-dimensional geometric object usually stored as a sequence of points, with the subtype of Curve specifying the form of the interpolation between points.
    Surface2D
    A Surface is a two-dimensional geometric object.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Geometry2DException
    If there's any error dealing with geometries an instance of this exception should be thrown.

Package xxl.core.spatial.geometries Description

The package geometries provides interfaces for a spatial data model which conforms to the geometry model of the OGC Simple Features Specification for SQL (See http://www.opengis.org for further details).
A concrete implementation of this model can be found in xxl.connectivity.jts.
